analysis.title: Hanna
analysis.author: Seth Lochhead & David Farr
analysis.logline: A genetically enhanced teenage assassin trained by her father escapes CIA pursuit to uncover her mysterious origins and confront the woman responsible for her creation.

concept.justification: Unique twist on assassin genre with genetic modification backstory, compelling protagonist journey of self-discovery

structure.justification: Tight three-act structure with clear progression, propulsive pacing, and organic plot development

protagonist.justification: Hanna is complex, active, with clear goals and profound character arc from trained weapon to self-actualized individual

supporting_cast.justification: Rich supporting characters like Erik, Marissa, Sophie provide depth and narrative complexity

dialogue.justification: Crisp, efficient dialogue revealing character through subtext, occasional naturalistic teen interactions

genre_execution.justification: Masterful blend of spy thriller mechanics with coming-of-age emotional landscape

originality.justification: Fresh take on genetic modification narrative, subverts typical female action protagonist tropes

target_audience.note: Wide appeal across action and coming-of-age demographics

cast_attachability.note: Strong lead role for young actress

marketing_hook.note: Trailer-ready action sequences, intriguing genetic modification angle

budget_return_ratio.note: Moderate budget action film with franchise potential

structure_analysis.act_breaks: First act: Forest training, Second act: Escape/Discovery, Third act: Confrontation at Galinka

characters.protagonist: Hanna - Genetically modified teenage assassin seeking identity, hyper-competent yet emotionally naive
characters.antagonist: Marissa Wiegler - CIA operative responsible for genetic modification program, cold and calculating
supporting: Sophie - Teenage friend providing emotional contrast

standout_scenes.why: Demonstrates protagonist's training and capabilities through ingenious, methodical breakout
Intense psychological revelation about Hanna's true origins

comparable_films.title: Bourne Identity
comparable_films.similarity: Genetically enhanced protagonist discovering true identity

comparable_films.title: Leon: The Professional
comparable_films.similarity: Young assassin trained by father figure

budget_tier.justification: Requires substantial action choreography and production design, but not massive blockbuster scale

strengths: Emotional depth unusual in action genre
assessment.recommendation_rationale: Exceptional weighted score of 8.45, zero critical failures, strong commercial viability score of 16, and breakthrough protagonist journey make this a compelling development opportunity.

analysis.verdict_statement: Based on its innovative narrative approach, complex protagonist, and commercial potential, this screenplay demonstrates remarkable craft execution that warrants immediate development consideration. Hanna presents a uniquely castable lead role that could launch a breakthrough performance for a young actress.
